isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-28 - Replacement of Copper / Brass Core Radiators with Aluminum Core Radiators in 5000 Models Built from 1994 to Current Production and 9000 Models Built Between 1994 and October 2002

subjectgroup.subject: Replacement of Copper / Brass Core Radiators with Aluminum Core Radiators in 5000 Models Built from 1994 to Current Production and 9000 Models Built Between 1994 and October 2002

geninfo.para: When replacing a copper / brass core radiator with an aluminum core radiator the radiator frame to core isolators must be changed.
Care must be exercised when installing the new aluminum radiator to not pry the end frames onto the radiator to avoid damage to the radiator core.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death:

item.para: park the vehicle on a level surface
turn the engine off and chock the wheels
allow the engine cooling system to cool before performing the Service Procedure.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death from hot coolant or steam use only the following procedure to remove the pressure cap from the radiator or expansion tank. Allow the engine to cool. Wrap a thick, heavy cloth around the pressure cap. Push down, loosen the cap slowly to its first notch position; then pause a moment to allow pressure to release through the overflow tube. After pressure has been released, the pressure cap may be removed.

note.para: On the copper/ brass radiator there are two support rods on the front and back sides of the radiator that run from the top of the radiator to the bottom for added strength. The aluminum radiators do not require these four support rods so do not attempt to transfer the support rods from the old radiator to the new radiator. Refer to TSI-03-12-12 for more details.

step1.para: Drain the cooling system into a clean suitable container. Retain the coolant to refill the system.
Disconnect the radiator hoses and remove the radiator assembly from the vehicle.
Remove the copper/brass radiator core from the radiator frame. Clean the radiator frame of any debris.
Install new isolators, from Kit 2502216C91, into the bottom channel of the radiator frame.
Install the aluminum core onto the bottom channel. Support the aluminum core in the upright position and install both side channels.
Install new isolators into the top channel and place the top channel onto the radiator (Figure 1).

figure.caption: Figure 1. Assembly Of Frame Channels To The Radiator Core

caution.para: Do not use pry bars or screwdrivers to compress the isolators or to align bolt holes while assembling the radiator. To do so may result in damage to the radiator core (Figure 3 and Figure 4).

step1.para: Compress the radiator frame with hand pressure or a clamping means to draw the radiator core into the isolators and bolt hole alignment (Figure 2).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Area Of Damage (Circle) When Pry Bar Is Used
Figure 4. Close Up Of Damaged Area In Circle From Figure 3

step1.para: Install the radiator assembly into the vehicle.
Fill the cooling system and check for leaks.
